alert.note: Alert for Lamoille; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 9:05AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Increased Fire Weather Concerns in Lower Elevations of Central Vermont This Afternoon... * Lower elevations of central Vermont that have lost their snow cover are beginning to experience drying fuels according to the Vermont Department of Forest, Parks and Recreation. The combination of low relative humidity values between 25 to 30 percent and gusty southwest winds of 30 to 35 mph, may lead to a localized increase in fire weather concerns late this morning into early this evening. The period of strongest winds and lowest relative humidity values are expected from noon and 5 PM. If any fires were to start, the weather and localized fuel conditions may result in rapid fire spread. * For more information about the current fire danger rating, any burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.
